channel.title: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?
channel.description:
Hey, i am starting to make my own client and im starting by making the JFrame first.
I have done this so far by importing the JFrame and setting it so i cant resize it ect.
Here is my code.
i added notes to remind me what they mean (because im new to java) which helps alot.
[code]import javax.swing.JFrame; //This imports JFrame
public class MakeWindow{ //I have to remember to put public class then the java file's name.
public static void main(String[]args) //Find out what this does. { JFrame Window = new JFrame("Client"); //This creates the frame and lets you put the name of it in here.
Window.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE); //This makes the X button work. To stop it from working i would put DONT_EXIT_ON_CLOSE. Window.setSize(800,600); //This sets the windows size. Window.setVisible(true); //You must remember this for you to actually see the window. Window.setResizable(false);
} }[/code]
I don't know what this means though...
[code]public static void main(String[]args)[/code]
I need to know what this means before i carry on. Else i am not learning anything other than reading someones tutorial.

item.title: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:6, topic:271768”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=358614.msg2737871#msg2737871 date=1239143132]
wow, all first java tutorials teach you this :S even the shit ones.
[/quote]

specially Hello World…

if you are making your own runescape client, i see failure in your future, etc.[/quote]

If you didn’t ask questions, you would never learn anything.
Pull your finger out.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:
@abrhm2119 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:18, topic:271768”]Actually, I agree with him (for once). Pointers are not needed for such superficial reasons in C++ because you’re not using them for OO, and the C stdlib IS terrible. So yeah, what was he wrong about again?

Btw, can you get your botnet off the fucking irc?[/quote]i am not talking about C++, i am talking about C.

such comments are simply ignorant since he is stating that ‘pointers are a headache - or whatever’ and therefore that makes them bad in some sort?

as a matter of fact, it gives you MUCH more control of how your application runs.

@botnet shit: im b&.

io9:

And I tried C++, and when I did suck at it, nobody made fun of me simply because I bothered to look up my questions on Google before asking them, and when I did actually ask them, I didn’t act like a stubborn, ignorant ingrate when people directed me to the proper method of finding solutions simply because I was too lazy to actually listen to them.

even though we were talking about C, it demonstrates your complete ignorance.

item.title: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Killer-99-pkz:

Stop fucking criticizing him hes new to JAVA… I’m sure at one point you all didn’t know how to start a JAVA application.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 11, 2009, 11:02:23 am[/size][hr]This is just JAVA, try C++ see how funny it is when people make fun of you when you suck at a language.

I knew how to start a Java application before I knew how to program in Java, simply because I wasn’t a retarded unintuitive fuckwit who actually read documentation before using software.

And I tried C++, and when I did suck at it, nobody made fun of me simply because I bothered to look up my questions on Google before asking them, and when I did actually ask them, I didn’t act like a stubborn, ignorant ingrate when people directed me to the proper method of finding solutions simply because I was too lazy to actually listen to them.

item.title: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Its the main method, when you run the file, whatever is in that method it will do.

So for you, when it is ran, it creates a JFrame, sets its close operation, sets its size, sets its visibility, then sets its resizeableness or whatever.

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?

item.title: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @joewizard100 joewizard100
item.description:
@joewizard100 wrote:

Hey, i am starting to make my own client and im starting by making the JFrame first.

I have done this so far by importing the JFrame and setting it so i cant resize it ect.

Here is my code.

i added notes to remind me what they mean (because im new to java) which helps alot.

[code]import javax.swing.JFrame; //This imports JFrame

public class MakeWindow{ //I have to remember to put public class then the java file’s name.

public static void main(String[]args)  //Find out what this does.
	{
		JFrame Window = new JFrame("Client");  //This creates the frame and lets you put the name of it in here.
		
		
		Window.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);  //This makes the X button work. To stop it from working i would put DONT_EXIT_ON_CLOSE.
		Window.setSize(800,600);  //This sets the windows size.
		Window.setVisible(true);  //You must remember this for you to actually see the window.
		Window.setResizable(false);
				
		}
	}[/code]

I don’t know what this means though…

public static void main(String[]args)

I need to know what this means before i carry on. Else i am not learning anything other than reading someones tutorial.

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first JFrame... What does this mean?
